reviews.sentence: Top Notch Hotel in Indianapolis. Here on business I appreciated the efficiency of check in check out as well as a good breakfast buffet in the One South restaurant. The Fitness Center was also well equipped and the machines were in good condition. The room was very nice I believe recently renovated with plenty of room for both working and relaxation. Location is also good especially if you are in town for a convention at the convention center as I was. The only poor experience was that they only had one bartender even though the hotel was fully booked making for extremely slow service. I must note however that the bartender was doing his ultimate best and literally running back and forth to serve people. so hats off to his efforts.

Needs a lot of work. Not a good stay at all. One elevator always down none of the escalators working no hot water for a day Need to pick a better day to do repairs not during one of the biggest conventions in town. The whole place needs a big makeover. Not coming back.
Clean updated great location and if you are lucky enough a great view. This hotel has everything you need. A Starbucks bat and restaurant are all in the lobby. Would stay here again.

Great central location that allows many walkable restaurants and attractions. Rooms were clean and updated. Water in sink and shower could take 10 minutes and longer to heat up. The ice maker on our floor was out of order for all 3 days of our visit.

Dirty Room. This was my first and last stay at a Hyat. The rooms were overall dirty and not cared for. There was a inch of dust on every surface stained bathroom walls dirty dusty carpets poor ventilation dim terrible lighting broken hair dryer and iron. Housekeeping came daily but only made bed and replaced bathroom towels. Each day I returned to my room the dust was still there and floors were not vacuumed. Staff was not helpful and seemed uninterested in helping with suggestions for things to do in the area accommodating a late checkout and assisting with our stay. The location is good and the hotel has potential if the staff were better trained and the housekeeping was overhauled.

Excellent Hyat property smack dab in the center of downtown Indy. Recently updated with a very cool modern decor. Very nice restaurant that overlooks the city and a great lobby bar with a small food menu. Gym is nice and up to date. Walkable to most of the important locations in Indy.

A good choice when in Indianapolis. The Hyat has always been a nice hotel but this facility appears to have been renovated since my last stay here. Very nice and perfectly located in downtown Indianapolis. Usually conference food is only so so but I had one of the best steaks I ever had at a conference here. Hard to serve 100 people but the filet was perfectly served.

Nothing much seems to be at the standard regency level. Room was new and refurbished beds comfy location ify hotel and the common areas look very basic and nothing luxurious there were a lot of people staying and lifts took a long time. Lounge was well stocked. All in all nothing much.

Great Service. Nice Hotel. All of the people who work at the Indy Hyat were pleasant and very helpful. We had to take our car out 3 5 times a day over the weekend. The valet guys always had it ready and waiting. Parking in downtown Indy is not convenient. Anything we needed the answer was always yes. Our room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was great. The only reason I would not give this hotel 5 stars is the building itself. It is a sprawling multi use structure that connects to the mall and convention center across the street the signage could be better. The view out of our window was of the duct work on the roof of the adjacent part of the building. The hotel part is nice with visually interesting lobby areas and seems to be updated and well kept. But when you look across to the other part of the building very uninspiring. But I would stay here again. the employees are great and the rooms was comfortable and clean.

Hyat Regency Downtown Indianapolis. The hotel in a wonderful location. The parking garage is attached to the hotel with a skywalk into the Hyat. Parking is only 22 a day. Additionally a large shopping center is attached if desired on the other side of the skywalk. The rooms are clean updated bathrooms and the bed was clean and comfortable. We had a great view for the city. We ate at the Eagle Nest located on the top floor of the hotel. Perfect prime rib dinner. The staff from front desk to room service to housekeeping were very pleasant. Will stay again.

Great location and service. Expensive confusing parking. Great location. Clean. Few things needed updated bathrooms. Pool was clean and perfect temp. Check in was easy and you do not have to wait long for a room. We had a room at 100. Nice size TV beds were comfy and clean we always chek for bugs.

See what else is available. The hotel is in a good location but that is the only positive. I would not stay here again. The hotel needs a complete remodel with quality craftsmanship not the cheapest job. Also they need improvement in their housekeeping.

Nice Place GREAT location. Nothing to complain about. if there is anything to point out it would be the pool facilities could use some updating other than that service was very strong. Location was fantastic room was well prepared. right by everything. nice having a Starbucks in lobby. Overall pool facilities. something about the stainless steel ledges hot tub could be updated.

Great location but felt very understaffed. The location was great right in the middle of downtown. Only two elevators were working out of four so the wait to get up and down was very very long. Also our room had the ceiling tile in the bathroom moved over as if they had just done repairs and there was a dirty ring in the toilet as if it had n’t been cleaned at all. Also we called the front desk to get a cart brought up to load and check out and the phone rang for 5 minutes and no one ever answered.

This was not my favorite Hyat Regency property. The location was great but I was treated pretty rudely by the bellman. The property itself was quite loud and was in need of an update. The only nice thing was that I had a good view of the state capitol.

Underwhelmed. Hotel was in need of renovations and several things were not in working order including their hot tub. Called because smoke detector was chirping from the time we arrived was told someone would be up right away and no one ever came. Had to call again the next day and someone finally came to fix it. Over priced even for an inner city hotel. Completely unsatisfied not to mention parking for 2 days was 70 dollars.

Underwhelmed. One night stay for our anniversary. I booked online through the hotel and filled out the special request section. I had requested no feather bedding a higher floor and an updated room if that was a option. Upon check in the reception clerk acted as if she had no knowledge of my request. I do not understand the option of filling out a special request section if no one is going to pay attention to it. Upon entering our room we found feather pillows and feather duvet. I called the front desk and asked to please have the items replaced with non feather items. We ended up leaving for dinner after waiting a hour for items to be replaced and still no one showing up. They were replaced during our absence. We had issues with our A C the temperature in our room dropped to 61 degrees even though the thermostat was set on 74. Maintenance was sent to our room and he told us that there is a glitch in the system and he did not know when it would be fixed. Basically the higher you set the thermostat the longer the A C runs because the system does not know it is putting out cold air it is trying to raise the temperature. Very bizarre that the A C does not work properly in a major chain hotel. Room was tiny and odd shaped. No bathtub and the shower ceiling was so low that my husband was almost too tall to stand up straight to shower. This is not a hotel I would choose to stay at again if in the area. Definitely not what you would expect from a Hyat. I will say the valet staff was top notch.

Needs cleaned and renovated. There are some surface level renovations but others are much needed. Areas where there is rust or metal chipping away. There were scuff marks and dusty hairy baseboards in the room. The staff and food had good service especially Amanda in Catering.

Hyat regency indy. Rooms need an update. But overall very clean and staff is very friendly and accommodating. Not a lot of entertainment is provided but it is attached to a mall which is nice. would recommend for anyone looking for a place to stay in downtown.

Circle of lights stay. When we arrived our room had molded trash hidden the drawer old food bag. Their was old Starbucks trash in the trash can. I called down to the front desk and they moved us rooms and applied a 500 credit to use towards breakfast. Their pool was down for maintenance so they allowed us to use the pool at Conrad. My kids still had a great time and that was our main reason for staying.
